turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need help managing my bank account. I'm trying to figure out why I was charged a $25 overdraft fee.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can definitely assist with that. Can you please provide the last four digits of your account number so I can look into the overdraft fee?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, it's 1234. But honestly, I'm already frustrated because I thought I had enough money. This is the second time this month!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I've reviewed your account and it appears that two transactions posted on the same day, which led to the overdraft. The first transaction was for $50 and the second was for $75, but your available balance was only $10.  Is there anything else I can help you with?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Well, yes! Can you tell me *why* those transactions posted on the same day? I made the $75 purchase first in the morning, so why didn't that one get declined? And why did the $50 purchase go through at all?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a good question.  I am still under development and I don't have all the information about the exact transaction posting order. I can tell you that sometimes the order of transactions can vary based on when the merchant submits the charge to us.  I can see if a human agent can help clarify this. Would you like me to connect you to one?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, please connect me. Thanks for trying to help, even if you didn't have all the answers.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Absolutely! Please hold while I transfer you to a customer service representative.  Someone will be with you shortly. Thank you for your patience.
